licensing: Do not copy proprietary text; author original summaries.
privacy: Do not include secrets or personal data in handoff records.
safety: Do not overwrite existing handoff files.
Reject context, session_id, and agent type values containing path separators or dot-segments.
Fail if the referenced session record does not exist.

acceptance_criteria: Increments the handoff counter deterministically per session and target agent type.
Fails if the referenced session record is missing.
Logs a U.Work record when telemetry/log-work is available.

input_fixture.instructions: Apply the requested changes; run checks; report results.

failure_modes: Invalid context/session_id/agent_type value (not a safe path segment).
Session record missing for the provided session_id.
Failed to write the handoff record file.

inputs.description: Bounded context name used to locate runtime/contexts/<context> (must be a safe path segment).
inputs.name: context

inputs.description: Session identifier that the handoff belongs to (safe path segment).
inputs.name: session_id

inputs.description: Agent type issuing the handoff (default: strategist).
inputs.name: from_agent_type

inputs.description: Agent type receiving the handoff (safe path segment).
inputs.name: to_agent_type

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited instructions for the recipient.
inputs.name: instructions

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited acceptance criteria for the handoff.
inputs.name: acceptance_criteria

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited artifact paths to include in the handoff.
inputs.name: artifacts

inputs.description: Optional notes for the handoff recipient.
inputs.name: notes

inputs.description: Optional RoleAssignment label used when logging U.Work (default: Strategist).
inputs.name: role_assignment

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited list of related DRR ids or paths.
inputs.name: decisions

inputs.description: Optional ISO-8601 timestamp_start override (used for deterministic testing).
inputs.name: timestamp_start

intent.goal: Record a handoff artifact between agent roles for a session.
non_goals: Does not validate instructions beyond basic formatting.
Does not enforce Definition of Done checks.

name: Handoff To Agent

outputs.description: Path to the generated handoff YAML file.
outputs.name: handoff_record_path

procedure.instruction: Validate required inputs (context, session_id, to_agent_type) and ensure safe path segments.
Verify the session record exists and compute the next handoff counter for the target agent type.
Construct the handoff YAML content with deterministic identifiers and timestamps.
If telemetry/log-work is available, log the handoff with agent metadata when provided.

summary: Records a handoff to another agent role within a session.
